body_html:
When I profile the code, I see that numpy is spreading the load across all 8 CPU cores ( Intel i7 ), so I was somewhat expecting to see the benefit of having so many (2560) CUDA cores.
looks like earlier there were some efforts to take advantage of GPU showing 5x improvement over Intel MKL - https://s3.amazonaws.com/academia.edu.documents/30806706/Sheetal09Singular.pdf?AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAIWOWYYGZ2Y53UL3A&Expires=1506052362&Signature=gCpal%2Fk2dCnhAUXgYE4sgjqPNOo%3D&response-content-disposition=inline%3B%20filename%3DSingular_value_decomposition_on_GPU_usin.pdf

body:
When I profile the code, I see that numpy is spreading the load across all 8 CPU cores ( Intel i7 ), so I was somewhat expecting to see the benefit of having so many (2560) CUDA cores.
looks like earlier there were some efforts to take advantage of GPU showing 5x improvement over Intel MKL - https://s3.amazonaws.com/academia.edu.documents/30806706/Sheetal09Singular.pdf?AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAIWOWYYGZ2Y53UL3A&Expires=1506052362&Signature=gCpal%2Fk2dCnhAUXgYE4sgjqPNOo%3D&response-content-disposition=inline%3B%20filename%3DSingular_value_decomposition_on_GPU_usin.pdf
